alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 22 at 2:56AM PST until January 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM TODAY... * WHAT...Significant icing. Additional ice accumulations of a tenth to a quarter of an inch. Heaviest accumulations of ice will be in the Upper Hood River Valley. * WHERE...In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult, with icy and slick roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will climb above 32 degrees for most areas along the Columbia River by 9 am today, and across the Hood River Valley by early this afternoon. Spotty freezing rain is expected again later tonight into Tuesday morning, mainly across the Hood River Valley. But, new ice accumulations are expected to be less than 0.1 inch.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
